content.title: Update: Victim Advocacy Resource
content.description: Latest updates from The Meeting House.

text.text: The Overseers Board is committed to fostering a safe space for everyone at The Meeting House. As a tangible first step in the journey ahead, we have engaged a third-party victim advocate, Melodie Bissell, to independently and confidentially receive any concerns or allegations of sexual misconduct (including sexual abuse, sexual harassment, or abuse of power or authority) by a pastor, staff member, or lay leader within The Meeting House, whether current or historical.

Melodie has extensive professional experience and academic credentials working with victims of sexual misconduct within church and ministry settings. She has provided guidance and wisdom to our Overseers Board in recent weeks as we have processed and communicated the findings and outcome of the independent external investigation pertaining to Bruxy Cavey.

Melodie will provide, to any person who contacts her, confidential guidance and access to resources, including counseling resourcing and/or pastoral support in a victim-centric and trauma informed manner. She will also provide guidance to The Meeting House including, if the person consents, information to permit The Meeting House to take appropriate next steps.

Our desire, as we follow Jesus, is to create a culture of honesty, accountability, and transparency, and to do everything possible to foster a safe and caring church community. There is no room for sexual misconduct in our church.

The Overseers Board of The Meeting House encourages anyone who has experienced sexual misconduct by a pastor, staff member, or lay leader within The Meeting House to contact Melodie confidentially at:
mbissell@traumacareconsulting.com
Online referral form
Anyone who reaches out to Melodie through these channels will receive a response within two days.
March 9, 2022
March 9 - Due to the hundreds of questions we’ve received already, and the activity we’re seeing on social media, we’ve decided to host our Q & A Town Hall at the earliest opportunity.
We invite you to join this live streamed event this Thursday at 7pm. You can continue to send your questions to townhall@themeetinghouse.com.
Maggie John, Chair of the Overseers Board
March 8, 2022

We shared with our church community in early December that allegations of sexual misconduct were made against Bruxy Cavey. As soon as this information came to the attention of the Overseers Board, the Overseers put him on a leave of absence, and the church retained an external independent third-party investigator to conduct a thorough investigation into the allegations and to provide the Overseers Board with the findings.
The investigator’s work is now complete. Over the last number of days, the Overseers have read the report and we have taken time to process the information and consider the required actions.

The investigator determined that Bruxy had maintained a sexual relationship with the Victim, an adult woman, in violation of The Meeting House policy and the Handbook of Faith and Life of Be in Christ Church of Canada. The investigator also found that what became a sexual relationship between Bruxy and the Victim, which lasted over an extended period of time, constituted an abuse of Bruxy’s power and authority as a member of the clergy, and amounted to sexual harassment.

Due to the seriousness of the investigator’s findings, our Board unanimously decided to ask Bruxy to resign from his role at The Meeting House effective immediately. Bruxy then submitted his resignation on March 3rd, which the Overseers accepted.
The Meeting House stands against sexual misconduct, sexual harassment, and abuse of power and authority. We are praying through this situation.
Maggie John - Chair of the Overseers Board of The Meeting House
